definition.content:
# [TrailDiscover](https://traildiscover.cloud/)

This dashboard, built using data from traildiscover.cloud, offers a detailed visualization of AWS CloudTrail events that have been utilized or are potentially used by attackers. Events are organized according to MITRE ATT&CK tactics. Each event is presented with two widgets: one provides a description, a direct link to traildiscover.cloud, and references to related incidents and research; the other features a counter displaying the frequency of these events in your AWS environment.

### [AssumeRole](https://traildiscover.cloud/#STS-AssumeRole)

**Description:** Returns a set of temporary security credentials that you can use to access AWS resources.

**Related Incidents:**
- [The curious case of DangerDev@protonmail.me](https://www.invictus-ir.com/news/the-curious-case-of-dangerdev-protonmail-me)
- [Trouble in Paradise](https://blog.darklab.hk/2021/07/06/trouble-in-paradise/)
**Related Research:**
- [Role Chain Juggling](https://hackingthe.cloud/aws/post_exploitation/role-chain-juggling/)
- [Detecting and removing risky actions out of your IAM security policies](https://www.solvo.cloud/blog/detecting-and-removing-risky-actions-out-of-your-iam-security-policies/)

### [AssumeRoleWithSAML](https://traildiscover.cloud/#STS-AssumeRoleWithSAML)

**Description:** Returns a set of temporary security credentials for users who have been authenticated via a SAML authentication response.

**Related Research:**
- [AWS - STS Privesc](https://cloud.hacktricks.xyz/pentesting-cloud/aws-security/aws-privilege-escalation/aws-sts-privesc)

### [AssumeRoleWithWebIdentity](https://traildiscover.cloud/#STS-AssumeRoleWithWebIdentity)

**Description:** Returns a set of temporary security credentials for users who have been authenticated in a mobile or web application with a web identity provider.

**Related Research:**
- [From GitHub To Account Takeover: Misconfigured Actions Place GCP & AWS Accounts At Risk](https://www.rezonate.io/blog/github-misconfigurations-put-gcp-aws-in-account-takeover-risk/)

### [GetSessionToken](https://traildiscover.cloud/#STS-GetSessionToken)

**Description:** Returns a set of temporary credentials for an AWS account or IAM user.

**Related Incidents:**
- [New tactics and techniques for proactive threat detection](https://reinforce.awsevents.com/content/dam/reinforce/2024/slides/TDR432_New-tactics-and-techniques-for-proactive-threat-detection.pdf)
**Related Research:**
- [AWS STS GetSessionToken Abuse](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/security/7.17/aws-sts-getsessiontoken-abuse.html)

### [ConsoleLogin](https://traildiscover.cloud/#SignIn-ConsoleLogin)

**Description:** This is the CloudTrail event generated when you sign-in.

**Related Incidents:**
- [The curious case of DangerDev@protonmail.me](https://www.invictus-ir.com/news/the-curious-case-of-dangerdev-protonmail-me)
- [Responding to an attack in AWS](https://awstip.com/responding-to-an-attack-in-aws-9048a1a551ac)
- [Credential Phishing](https://ramimac.me/aws-phishing#credential-phishing)
- [Incident report: From CLI to console, chasing an attacker in AWS](https://expel.com/blog/incident-report-from-cli-to-console-chasing-an-attacker-in-aws/)
- [Tales from the cloud trenches: Amazon ECS is the new EC2 for crypto mining](https://securitylabs.datadoghq.com/articles/tales-from-the-cloud-trenches-ecs-crypto-mining/)
- [When a Zero Day and Access Keys Collide in the Cloud: Responding to the SugarCRM Zero-Day Vulnerability](https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/sugarcrm-cloud-incident-black-hat/)
- [Not a SIMulation: CrowdStrike Investigations Reveal Intrusion Campaign Targeting Telco and BPO Companies](https://www.crowdstrike.com/blog/analysis-of-intrusion-campaign-targeting-telecom-and-bpo-companies/)
**Related Research:**
- [Compromising AWS Console credentials](https://securitylabs.datadoghq.com/cloud-security-atlas/attacks/compromising-aws-console-credentials/)
- [Create a Console Session from IAM Credentials](https://hackingthe.cloud/aws/post_exploitation/create_a_console_session_from_iam_credentials/)
- [Enhancing Your Security Visibility and DetectionResponse Operations in AWS](https://pages.awscloud.com/rs/112-TZM-766/images/Visibility_detect_respond_AWS_SANS_whitepaper.pdf)

### [GetSigninToken](https://traildiscover.cloud/#SignIn-GetSigninToken)

**Description:** Generate a SigninToken that can be used to login to the the AWS Management Console.

**Related Incidents:**
- [Cloud-Conscious Tactics, Techniques,and Procedures (TTPs)](https://fwdcloudsec.org/assets/presentations/2024/europe/sebastian-walla-cloud-conscious-tactics-techniques-and-procedures-an-overview.pdf)

### [PasswordRecoveryRequested](https://traildiscover.cloud/#SignIn-PasswordRecoveryRequested)

**Description:** This is the CloudTrail event generated when you request a password recovery.

**Related Incidents:**
- [An Ongoing AWS Phishing Campaign](https://www.cadosecurity.com/an-ongoing-aws-phishing-campaign/)
- [Disclosure of Security Incidents on imToken](https://support.token.im/hc/en-us/articles/360005681954-Disclosure-of-Security-Incidents-on-imToken)

### [ResumeSession](https://traildiscover.cloud/#SSM-ResumeSession)

**Description:** Reconnects a session to a managed node after it has been disconnected.

**Related Research:**
- [Attack Paths Into VMs in the Cloud](https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/cloud-virtual-machine-attack-vectors/)

### [SendCommand](https://traildiscover.cloud/#SSM-SendCommand)

**Description:** Runs commands on one or more managed nodes.

**Related Incidents:**
- [Navigating the Cloud: Exploring Lateral Movement Techniques](https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/cloud-lateral-movement-techniques/)
- [Cloud-Conscious Tactics, Techniques,and Procedures (TTPs)](https://fwdcloudsec.org/assets/presentations/2024/europe/sebastian-walla-cloud-conscious-tactics-techniques-and-procedures-an-overview.pdf)
**Related Research:**
- [Hunting for signs of persistence in the cloud: an IR guide following the CircleCI incident](https://www.wiz.io/blog/hunting-for-signs-of-persistence-in-the-cloud-an-ir-guide)
- [Run Shell Commands on EC2 with Send Command or Session Manager](https://hackingthe.cloud/aws/post_exploitation/run_shell_commands_on_ec2/)
- [Attack Paths Into VMs in the Cloud](https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/cloud-virtual-machine-attack-vectors/)

### [StartSession](https://traildiscover.cloud/#SSM-StartSession)

**Description:** Initiates a connection to a target (for example, a managed node) for a Session Manager session.

**Related Incidents:**
- [Navigating the Cloud: Exploring Lateral Movement Techniques](https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/cloud-lateral-movement-techniques/)
**Related Research:**
- [Hunting for signs of persistence in the cloud: an IR guide following the CircleCI incident](https://www.wiz.io/blog/hunting-for-signs-of-persistence-in-the-cloud-an-ir-guide)
- [Run Shell Commands on EC2 with Send Command or Session Manager](https://hackingthe.cloud/aws/post_exploitation/run_shell_commands_on_ec2/)

### [CreateApiKey](https://traildiscover.cloud/#AppSync-CreateApiKey)

**Description:** Creates a unique key that you can distribute to clients who invoke your API.

**Related Research:**
- [Distorting the Sync: How AWS AppSync Can Be Turned into an Attacker’s Backdoor](https://medium.com/@adan.alvarez/distorting-the-sync-how-aws-appsync-can-be-turned-into-an-attackers-backdoor-8c015b8e52b8)

### [UpdateGraphqlApi](https://traildiscover.cloud/#AppSync-UpdateGraphqlApi)

**Description:** Updates a GraphqlApi object.

**Related Research:**
- [Distorting the Sync: How AWS AppSync Can Be Turned into an Attacker’s Backdoor](https://medium.com/@adan.alvarez/distorting-the-sync-how-aws-appsync-can-be-turned-into-an-attackers-backdoor-8c015b8e52b8)

### [UpdateResolver](https://traildiscover.cloud/#AppSync-UpdateResolver)

**Description:** Updates a Resolver object.

**Related Research:**
- [Distorting the Sync: How AWS AppSync Can Be Turned into an Attacker’s Backdoor](https://medium.com/@adan.alvarez/distorting-the-sync-how-aws-appsync-can-be-turned-into-an-attackers-backdoor-8c015b8e52b8)

### [AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress](https://traildiscover.cloud/#EC2-AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress)

**Description:** Adds the specified inbound (ingress) rules to a security group.

**Related Incidents:**
- [The curious case of DangerDev@protonmail.me](https://www.invictus-ir.com/news/the-curious-case-of-dangerdev-protonmail-me)
- [Finding evil in AWS](https://expel.com/blog/finding-evil-in-aws/)
- [Tales from the cloud trenches: Amazon ECS is the new EC2 for crypto mining](https://securitylabs.datadoghq.com/articles/tales-from-the-cloud-trenches-ecs-crypto-mining/)
- [Behind the scenes in the Expel SOC: Alert-to-fix in AWS](https://expel.com/blog/behind-the-scenes-expel-soc-alert-aws/)
- [When a Zero Day and Access Keys Collide in the Cloud: Responding to the SugarCRM Zero-Day Vulnerability](https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/sugarcrm-cloud-incident-black-hat/)
- [UNMASKING GUI-VIL: FINANCIALLY MOTIVATED CLOUD THREAT ACTOR](https://permiso.io/blog/s/unmasking-guivil-new-cloud-threat-actor/)
- [BrowserStack analysis: unpatched inactive machine compromised by shellshock vulnerability](https://www.databreaches.net/browserstack-analysis-unpatched-inactive-machine-compromised-by-shellshock-vulnerability/)
- [Navigating the Cloud: Exploring Lateral Movement Techniques](https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/cloud-lateral-movement-techniques/)
- [New tactics and techniques for proactive threat detection](https://reinforce.awsevents.com/content/dam/reinforce/2024/slides/TDR432_New-tactics-and-techniques-for-proactive-threat-detection.pdf)
**Related Research:**
- [Opening a security group to the Internet](https://securitylabs.datadoghq.com/cloud-security-atlas/attacks/opening-security-group-port/)

### [CreateDefaultVpc](https://traildiscover.cloud/#EC2-CreateDefaultVpc)

**Description:** Creates a default VPC with a size /16 IPv4 CIDR block and a default subnet in each Availability Zone.

**Related Incidents:**
- [The curious case of DangerDev@protonmail.me](https://www.invictus-ir.com/news/the-curious-case-of-dangerdev-protonmail-me)

### [CreateKeyPair](https://traildiscover.cloud/#EC2-CreateKeyPair)

**Description:** Creates an ED25519 or 2048-bit RSA key pair with the specified name and in the specified PEM or PPK format.

**Related Incidents:**
- [The curious case of DangerDev@protonmail.me](https://www.invictus-ir.com/news/the-curious-case-of-dangerdev-protonmail-me)
- [ANATOMY OF AN ATTACK: EXPOSED KEYS TO CRYPTO MINING](https://permiso.io/blog/s/anatomy-of-attack-exposed-keys-to-crypto-mining/)
- [UNMASKING GUI-VIL: FINANCIALLY MOTIVATED CLOUD THREAT ACTOR](https://permiso.io/blog/s/unmasking-guivil-new-cloud-threat-actor/)
**Related Research:**
- [Following attackers’ (Cloud)trail in AWS: Methodology and findings in the wild](https://securitylabs.datadoghq.com/articles/following-attackers-trail-in-aws-methodology-findings-in-the-wild/)

### [CreateNetworkAclEntry](https://traildiscover.cloud/#EC2-CreateNetworkAclEntry)

**Description:** Creates an entry (a rule) in a network ACL with the specified rule number.

**Related Research:**
- [AWS EC2 Network Access Control List Creation](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/security/current/aws-ec2-network-access-control-list-creation.html)
- [Enhancing Your Security Visibility and DetectionResponse Operations in AWS](https://pages.awscloud.com/rs/112-TZM-766/images/Visibility_detect_respond_AWS_SANS_whitepaper.pdf)

### [CreateSecurityGroup](https://traildiscover.cloud/#EC2-CreateSecurityGroup)

**Description:** Creates a security group.

**Related Incidents:**
- [The curious case of DangerDev@protonmail.me](https://www.invictus-ir.com/news/the-curious-case-of-dangerdev-protonmail-me)
- [Tales from the cloud trenches: Amazon ECS is the new EC2 for crypto mining](https://securitylabs.datadoghq.com/articles/tales-from-the-cloud-trenches-ecs-crypto-mining/)
- [Behind the scenes in the Expel SOC: Alert-to-fix in AWS](https://expel.com/blog/behind-the-scenes-expel-soc-alert-aws/)
- [When a Zero Day and Access Keys Collide in the Cloud: Responding to the SugarCRM Zero-Day Vulnerability](https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/sugarcrm-cloud-incident-black-hat/)
- [ANATOMY OF AN ATTACK: EXPOSED KEYS TO CRYPTO MINING](https://permiso.io/blog/s/anatomy-of-attack-exposed-keys-to-crypto-mining/)
**Related Research:**
- [Following attackers’ (Cloud)trail in AWS: Methodology and findings in the wild](https://securitylabs.datadoghq.com/articles/following-attackers-trail-in-aws-methodology-findings-in-the-wild/)
- [Abusing VPC Traffic Mirroring in AWS](https://rhinosecuritylabs.com/aws/abusing-vpc-traffic-mirroring-in-aws/)

### [ImportKeyPair](https://traildiscover.cloud/#EC2-ImportKeyPair)

**Description:** Imports the public key from an RSA or ED25519 key pair that you created with a third-party tool.

**Related Incidents:**
- [Tales from the cloud trenches: Amazon ECS is the new EC2 for crypto mining](https://securitylabs.datadoghq.com/articles/tales-from-the-cloud-trenches-ecs-crypto-mining/)
- [Behind the scenes in the Expel SOC: Alert-to-fix in AWS](https://expel.com/blog/behind-the-scenes-expel-soc-alert-aws/)
- [When a Zero Day and Access Keys Collide in the Cloud: Responding to the SugarCRM Zero-Day Vulnerability](https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/sugarcrm-cloud-incident-black-hat/)
**Related Research:**
- [Hunting for signs of persistence in the cloud: an IR guide following the CircleCI incident](https://www.wiz.io/blog/hunting-for-signs-of-persistence-in-the-cloud-an-ir-guide)

### [RunInstances](https://traildiscover.cloud/#EC2-RunInstances)

**Description:** Launches the specified number of instances using an AMI for which you have permissions.

**Related Incidents:**
- [The curious case of DangerDev@protonmail.me](https://www.invictus-ir.com/news/the-curious-case-of-dangerdev-protonmail-me)
- [DXC spills AWS private keys on public GitHub](https://www.theregister.com/2017/11/14/dxc_github_aws_keys_leaked/)
